title: Magnitude 5.3 quake hits western Iran, no casualties reported: TV
text:
April 1, 2018 / 9:37 AM / Updated 6 hours ago Magnitude 5.3 quake hits western Iran, dozens with minor injuries Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
DUBAI (Reuters) - A magnitude 5.3 earthquake hit western Iran on Sunday, injuring at least 38 people, a spokesman for the countryâ€™s medical emergency services said. 
Most of the 38 were released after receiving treatment in hospitals in the affected province of Kermanshah, Mojtaba Khaledi told the semi-official news agency ISNA. 
Iranian news agencies said most of the injuries were minor, with some people being hurt on the head by falling items. 
A magnitude 7.3 earthquake that shook that area and neighboring Iraq in November killed more than 600 people and injured more than 8,000. Reporting by Dubai newsroom; Editing by Alison Williams
